document_data.name: Laerlos Silmerhelve II
document_data.mainbody: Lord '''Laerlos Silmerhelve II''' was one of the [[Moonlight Men]], companions of famed bard [[Mintiper Moonsilver]], who fell in the [[Battle of Turnstone Pass]] against a horde of [[orc]]s. Laerlos' bravery was immortalized in the ballad ''[[Moonlight Paean]]'', which was included in ''[[Mintiper's Chapbook]]''.
document_data.Personality: Laerlos was proud and rebellious against his parents.
document_data.Possessions: At the time of his death, Laerlos was in possession of several of his family's heirlooms, the ''[[griffonlance of goring]]'', ''[[Nimoar's blazing bulwark]]'', and the ''[[silverhelm of the Guardian]]'', which was a [[relic]] of the god [[Helm]].
document_data.Relationships: Laerlos was the only son of Lord [[Laerlos Silmerhelve|Laerlos Silmerhelve I]] and his wife Lady [[Tannyth Silmerhelve|Tannyth]]. They were of [[Silmerhelve|House Silmerhelve]] of [[Waterdeep]].
document_data.History: Against his family's wishes, Laerlos II left Waterdeep to join the Moonlight Men. He was slain in the {{YearlinkName|1343}}, but he was one of the most notable members of the Men mentioned in the ''Paean''.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: The three family relics of the Silmerhelve family were thought to still lie in the [[Cairn of Moonlight]], a secret barrow where the fallen from the battle were said to have been buried along with their treasures.
